Ember Data question – I’m getting two `hasMany` relations off a single model – `users` and `owners`. Can I merge these in a listing and indicate which `users` were also `owners`? Or is this the wrong way to do it!

<@U14KVFYS3>: you could add a computed property to the model:
```
usersAndOwners: computed('users.[]', 'owners.[]', function() {
  return this.get('users').concat(this.get('owners'));
})
```
…but then you lose some fidelity from the two "magic" arrays… methods like `users.reload()` etc.
Better I think is to merge them as _late_ and _lazily_ as possible, possibly with a helper:
```
{{#each (union model.users model.owners) as |person|}}
  ...
{{/each}}
```
That uses the `union` helper from an addon: <https://github.com/DockYard/ember-composable-helpers#union>
